valueFormat.structure: Offset object with x and y coordinates
valueFormat.notes: Controls the offset distance from the target element. Positive values move tooltip away from target, negative values move closer.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using string values instead of numbers
commonMistakes.fix: Use numbers: { x: 4, y: 4 } not { x: '4px', y: '4px' }

commonMistakes.impact: Tooltip appears too far from target, poor UX
commonMistakes.fix: Keep offset values small (4-16px) for better UX

valueFormat.structure: Absolute positioning object with top, left, bottom, right coordinates
valueFormat.objectShape: { top?: number, left?: number, bottom?: number, right?: number }
valueFormat.notes: When provided, tooltip uses absolute positioning instead of dynamic positioning. Useful for fixed tooltip locations.
valueFormat.typescript: { top?: number; left?: number; bottom?: number; right?: number }

commonMistakes.impact: absolutePosition is ignored when dynamic positioning is enabled
Tooltip may overflow viewport or cover target element

commonMistakes.mistake: Setting conflicting positions (both top and bottom)
commonMistakes.fix: Use either top OR bottom, and either left OR right

valueFormat.notes: When true, tooltip automatically positions itself to stay within viewport bounds. When false, uses staticPosition or absolutePosition.

commonMistakes.fix: Use dynamicPosition=false when you want absolute positioning

valueFormat.notes: Format: '[vertical] [horizontal]' where vertical is top/bottom/center and horizontal is left/right/center

commonMistakes.fix: Use only: top, bottom, center (vertical) and left, right, center (horizontal)
Always use format: 'vertical horizontal' (e.g., 'top center' not 'center top')

commonMistakes.title: Using absolutePosition with dynamicPosition enabled
commonMistakes.description: When dynamicPosition is true, absolutePosition prop is completely ignored
commonMistakes.impact: Tooltip doesn't appear where expected, absolutePosition settings have no effect

commonMistakes.title: Using string values for offset coordinates
commonMistakes.description: offset.x and offset.y must be numbers, not strings with units
commonMistakes.impact: Tooltip positioning breaks, may not appear or appear in wrong location

commonMistakes.title: Not considering viewport boundaries
commonMistakes.description: When using static or absolute positioning, tooltip may overflow viewport
commonMistakes.impact: Tooltip may be cut off or hidden when near viewport edges

commonMistakes.title: Not providing accessible content
commonMistakes.description: Tooltip content should be descriptive and accessible
commonMistakes.impact: Poor accessibility for screen readers, unclear purpose

commonMistakes.title: Using dynamic positioning for static layouts
commonMistakes.description: If tooltip target never moves, dynamic positioning is unnecessary overhead
commonMistakes.impact: Unnecessary calculations on every render, minor performance impact

bestPractices.title: Use Dynamic Positioning for Responsive Layouts
bestPractices.description: Enable dynamic positioning when tooltip target may be near viewport edges or in scrollable containers
bestPractices.code:
<InTooltipV2
  :dynamic-position="true"
  tooltip-text="This tooltip will adjust its position to stay visible"
/>
bestPractices.benefit: Ensures tooltip is always visible and readable, better UX across different screen sizes

bestPractices.title: Keep Offset Values Small
bestPractices.description: Use small offset values (4-16px) to maintain visual connection between tooltip and target
bestPractices.benefit: Clear visual relationship between tooltip and its trigger element

bestPractices.title: Use Static Positioning for Fixed Layouts
bestPractices.description: When tooltip target has fixed position, use static positioning for better performance
bestPractices.benefit: Better performance, no unnecessary position calculations

bestPractices.title: Provide Clear, Concise Tooltip Text
bestPractices.description: Keep tooltip content brief and informative (1-2 sentences max)
bestPractices.code:
<InTooltipV2
  tooltip-text="Save your changes before leaving this page"
  :prevent-xss="true"
/>
bestPractices.benefit: Better readability, faster comprehension, improved accessibility

bestPractices.title: Enable XSS Protection for User-Generated Content
bestPractices.description: Always enable preventXss when displaying user-provided content in tooltips
bestPractices.benefit: Prevents XSS attacks, secure handling of untrusted content

customOffset.code:

  id="icon-tip"
  :offset="{ x: 0, y: 16 }"

/>

performanceNotes.description: Dynamic positioning recalculates on every render to detect viewport boundaries.
performanceNotes.recommendation: Use static positioning (dynamic-position="false") when tooltip placement is predictable. Only use dynamic for edge cases near viewport boundaries.

performanceNotes.description: When prevent-xss is enabled, tooltip text is sanitized on every render.
performanceNotes.recommendation: Keep prevent-xss="true" (default) for security. If displaying trusted content only, can disable for slight performance gain.

performanceNotes.description: Many tooltips with dynamic positioning can impact scroll performance due to continuous recalculation.
performanceNotes.recommendation: Limit dynamic tooltips on scrollable pages. Use static positioning for table headers or repeated elements.

accessibilityNotes.description: Tooltip text should provide useful information, not just repeat visible text.
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Explain what an element does or provide context. Avoid redundancy.
accessibilityNotes.example:
Good: 'Delete this item permanently'
Bad: 'Delete' (when button already says Delete)

accessibilityNotes.description: Component automatically adds role='tooltip' and aria-describedby for screen readers.
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: No action needed - component handles ARIA internally.

accessibilityNotes.description: Tooltip background and text must meet WCAG AA contrast ratio (4.5:1).
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Default theme meets standards. If customizing colors, test contrast with tools like WebAIM.
accessibilityNotes.example: Default: Dark gray background (#333) with white text - 12.6:1 ratio

accessibilityNotes.description: Tooltips should be accessible via keyboard focus, not just hover.
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Ensure parent element is focusable (button, link, or tabindex="0"). Tooltip shows on focus.
